text: Roz Chast has been a cartoonist at The New Yorker for about four decades. In a recent Profile, Adam Gopnik took a closer look at her achievements and her everyday life as a successful artist—a world luxuriously filled with friends, family, and obligations. https://t.co/0DjYZOTSGw

text: When COVID-19 overran the U.S., the Army Corps of Engineers was determined to provide vital infrastructure quickly. Between late March and the end of June, the Corps built 38 alternate care facilities nationwide, adding more than 15,000 hospital beds. https://t.co/HW4CX2ce5s
